page.title: 06BELIEFS IN DAGENHAM (contd.)
page.content: King Arthur, mermaids and tooth fairies. Of all people surveyed, 87% said they believed in dinosaurs. Only the dangers of too much sugar was more widely believed. About a quarter believed in regular church going,{Loch {Ness Monster,}black magic and Father Christmas. About half believed in Hannibal, King Arthur, Hercules and { {ghosts,}two thirds in cannibals and evolution;three quarters believed in St. George; and about one third believed in popular superstitions about broken mirrors bringing 7 years bad luckand placing shoes on the table.
